Question: What should you do if the vehicle behind you wishes to pass?

Answers.Answer: Move to the centre so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe

Question: If you have a restricted licence you can carry a passenger if they are your spouse.
When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.
Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There has been a crash – slow down to 20km/h when passing this sign until you have passed the crash
There have been crashes here in the past – slow down
There has been a crash – but the road is clear now
This is an accident black spot

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

Question: What is the least distance of clear road you MUST have in front of you when you have finished passing another vehicle?
You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving at the same speed
Keep driving at the same speed and flash the vehicle’s headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Slow down and move to the right-hand side of the road

Question: The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top right corner of the windscreen

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Before making a lane change to your left, you must signal for at least 3 seconds. What else must you do?

Answers.Answer: Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights) to warn other road users
Use your vehicle hazard lights to warn other road users
Check your blind spot before moving left
Ensure that there are no oncoming vehicles

Question: When are you allowed to pass another vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are coming up to a blind corner or blind bend
When a vehicle has stopped at a pedestrian crossing
When you can see at least 100 metres of clear road in front of you once you have finished passing
When you are less than 10 metres away from a railway level crossing

Question: What must you do at an intersection controlled by a Stop sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Stop only if you can do so safely
Continue driving unless you can see an oncoming vehicle

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There is loose gravel on the road that could break your windscreen
There is broken glass on the road

Question: What does ‘the speed limit’ mean?

Answers.Answer: The slowest speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive in good conditions
The average speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive, except when overtaking

Question: What must you do when red lights are flashing at a railway level crossing?

Answers.Answer: Drive over the lines as soon as the train has passed
Slow down and then drive over the lines
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Stop and if no train is coming you may drive over the lines

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: Which person can legally stop and do a roadside check of your vehicle?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the closest distance your vehicle may be parked to a vehicle entrance?
You are in the left-hand lane at traffic signals. You are waiting to turn left. At which of these traffic signals may you move on?
At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
When should you use your hazard lights?

Answers.Answer: When your vehicle becomes a temporary hazard to other road users
When approaching an accident scene to warn other drivers
When reversing from a driveway and your view is not clear

Question: When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?
You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
If you are a driver involved in a crash, what is the FIRST action you should take?

Answers.Answer: Stop and place a warning triangle at the side of the road
Drive past at 20km/h until you pass the site of the crash
Stop and check to see if anyone is hurt
Tell a police officer as soon as possible

Question: To tow a trailer on a restricted driver licence, the weight of your vehicle plus the weight of the trailer and its load must not exceed what weight?
What is the meaning of a yellow broken line painted on the road near the kerb?

Answers.Answer: You may stop for no more than 5 minutes

Question: A police officer can impound your car on the spot if you are caught driving while disqualified.
If you are turning left at an intersection, you must give way to vehicles coming towards you that are turning right.
